name: Restore data for customers (WIP)
title: Restore data for customers (WIP)
body:
Original Confluence URL: https://qbdocs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/1LS/pages/3166666758/Restore+data+for+customers - please cross-check the quality of the ZD article with the Confluence counterpart and remove this line before publishing the ZD article

Overview

This article provides a comprehensive guide on how to restore data for customers using the EFS (Enterprise Feedback Suite) system. It covers the general conditions, required information, step-by-step process, and definitions of standard restores.

Information

This guide focuses on the process of restoring lost or deleted data for customers using the EFS system. It outlines the necessary steps, responsibilities, and considerations for both support teams and customers.

    • General Conditions
    • Required Information
    • Process Steps
    • Standard Restores
    • Information Checklist

General Conditions

Before proceeding with data restoration, it's important to consider the following:

  • Data analysis and recovery may incur costs, including:
    • Setting up a mirror EFS instance (2.5 k (Euro) or 2.75 k (USD) )
    • Deeper analysis by EFS Technical Support (if no software bug or exception caused the loss)
    • Actual recovery costs per hour

Required Information

To recover lost data, the following information is needed:

  • Type of missing or lost data (e.g., whole project, respondent data, panelist data)
  • Installation details (Customer and EFS installation URL)
  • Date of data deletion or when it was first noticed as missing
  • Desired location for data restoration (e.g., live EFS instance, copy of the project)

Process Steps

Step 1: Information Collection

1st Level Support collects all necessary information from the customer.

Step 2: Issue Creation

1st Level Support opens an issue with SaaS Team.

Step 3: Cause and Recovery Assessment

The Professional Service Team checks the cause of data loss and determines if recovery is possible.

Step 4: Recovery Options

If recovery is possible, the Professional Service Team provides options and time estimates to 1st Level Support.

Step 5: Customer Agreement (Need Internal Review)

1st Level Support discusses options and costs with the customer.

Step 6: Mirror Setup (if needed)

If a mirror is needed, 1st Level Support requests SaaS Team to create one.

Step 7: Data Recovery

Depending on the situation, either the customer or the Professional Service Team does the data recovery.

Step 8: Completion and Notification (Need Internal Review)

Professional Service Team informs 1st Level Support of successful recovery, who then notifies the customer and Sales department.

Step 9: Mirror Deletion

After successful recovery, SaaS Team is informed to delete the mirror (if applicable).

Standard Restores

Standard restores are defined by the following criteria:

  • EFS instance is hosted in GSA2
  • Date/time of deletion fits GSA2 Backup Policy
  • Customer should be able to perform the restore independently

Examples of standard restores include:

  • Complete projects meeting the above criteria
  • Survey layouts that can be exported and imported
  • Mail templates that can be recreated using copy and paste

Information Checklist

Use this checklist to ensure all necessary information is collected:

  • Customer name
  • Responsible contact person
  • EFS instance
  • Data to be restored
  • Date of data deletion or loss
  • Cause of data loss
  • Desired restoration location
  • Who will perform the restoration (customer or EFS Technical Support)
  • Associated costs (if applicable)

Note: The data can not be directly restored to the production instance. It would be provided through a mirror installation. If the customer wants a direct restore, it needs to go to the Professional Service Team.

FAQ

What types of data can be restored?

Various types of data can be restored, including whole projects, respondent data, panelist data, survey layouts, and mail templates. The specific type of data that can be restored depends on the circumstances of the data loss and the backup policies in place.

How much does data restoration cost?

The cost of data restoration varies depending on several factors, including the need for a mirror EFS instance, the complexity of the recovery process, and whether EFS Technical Support needs to perform the restoration. Costs may include setup fees for mirror instances and hourly rates for technical support. Exact costs should be discussed with the support team on a case-by-case basis.

Can customers perform data restoration themselves?

In some cases, especially for standard restores, customers may be able to perform the data restoration themselves. This typically applies to situations where the EFS instance is hosted in GSA2, the deletion date fits the GSA2 Backup Policy, and the type of data lost is relatively straightforward to restore (e.g., survey layouts or mail templates).
